Sentence: The uniformity of the superconducting properties throughout the volume of the MgB 2 cylinder, which is required to gen- erate high trapped fields, was investigated by cutting nine, relatively large (4 mmï Ãï 3 mmï Ãï 2 mm) rectangular samples from various positions within the MPIG bulk.

As a result, superconducting 'permanent magnets' have the potential to generate magnetic fields that are significantly higher than conventional Nd-Fe-B magnets, which are limited generally to less than 2 T. MgB 2 superconductors, in part- icular, have already been used to generate trapped fields of greater than 5 T .
